website_summaries.verdict: Unmatched durability and a solid choice for features such as a bladder and water storage compartment. The best available.
pros: Delights owners with its extremely durable construction
cons: The zippers feel a bit flimsy, which is surprising given this backpack's price tag

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pack.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room. Able to fit a three litter hydro pack. It's comfortable easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Backpacking around Europe for a month
customer_reviews.text: I went backpacking around Europe for a month and I used this for the entire trip. It was everything I needed for such a trip.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: bag is great but I wouldn't purchase it based on how little ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this backpack and after one 5 day trip, the bottom began ripping. As you can see on the picture the bag is brand new except for on the bottom where it has begun to rip. Besides that, bag is great but I wouldn't purchase it based on how little it lasted without ripping
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fit, comfort, and durability
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY reason I returned the 3400 was because I needed the 4000 (the 65l size) The 3400 was extremely comfortable, easy to adjust and felt incredibly well made. Especially for the price. Unfortunately I like winter camping. And the 3400 was just a bit too small for a winter load out. If you're in the market for an affordable 3 season backpack, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: When I was getting a backpack, I was trying to get something that would not be really big. I didn’t want to make it so that I would put so much in it that it would be too heavy to carry. When I got this, it was one of the smaller backpacks I was looking at. It still has a lot of room, but it doesn’t seem very big at all. It’s really a good size for me. It seems to carry all the things that I really need for a good 2 to 3 day hike. Construction is really good. I think I’m going to enjoy hiking!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Using it as my go bag
customer_reviews.text: Using it as my go bag. Has great capacity. I like that it is adjustable for my 5’10” 170 pound frame. I was able to adjust it so that it fit comfortably on my back and distributing much of the weight to my hips. I am able to squeeze my sleeping bag into the sleeping bag pouch on the bottom of the backpack. I wasn’t sure if that would be possible, as it seems pretty small, but it worked fine. What could make it better is if there were small pouches on the hip strap for frequently used items.
customer_reviews.author: Weston JM

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Very uncomfortable, no matter how I adjusted the straps (and I watched videos on how to wear it properly) it was still horrible. Plus one of the aglettes came off first time out . I sent it back
customer_reviews.author: fionac

customer_reviews.title: Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pack for the money I have. I own 3 Teton packs. This is my biggest. I have used on extended hikes. Very comfortable. Fabric is tough and shows no signs of snags or thinning. Straps are more comfortable than more expensive packs I've used in the past. I'm 5'4 inches 155 lbs and it fits me very well and rides at the right height. I will recommend Teton products to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Good for multi-day camping trips
customer_reviews.text: My son uses it for boyscouts. The pocket placement and the fact that it has a sleeping bag compartment makes it great for multi day hikes. He likes the adjustability and the way it sit and fit on his back. He also like that he had a pocket for everything and nothing needed to dangle on the outside. He is 5’2” and weighs 100lbs and carries this with confidence. This bag fit his sleeping bag, clothes for two days, utensils and bowls, 3 liter water camel bak, ten essentials, sleeping Pad, rain fly and poles from a shared tent, shower shoes a small towel and coupe of fleeces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Worked well and as advertised! Just be sure to check the sizing for your torso.
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy and as advertised. Have used it twice for short backpacking (2 miles one way camping). Comfortable, from what I have noticed. I bought this pack thinking all packs are equal, but it is actually a little small for my torso (I think this is for someone 5'9" or shorter and I am 5'11" with a longer torso). I'm going to keep it for smaller hikes and for my wife or friends to use, and eventually get a better fit in the future. I will probably go with this company for the price/quality when I do purchase. Customer service was helpful, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a recent backpacking trip. REI was closed and I figured this would be an inexpensive alternative until I could be fitted for a pack. After using this on a weekend trip, I actually don't think I'll be buying another pack. It was a great size and was very comfortable, I would definitely recommend it to a friend. I took off one star because of a defect in where the material was stitched into a seam and I had to cut the material out leaving a small hole. Normally I would have asked for a replacement, but I didn't have time before my trip.
customer_reviews.author: jjbanana

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad pack for the money
customer_reviews.text: It really is an excellent pack for the money but unhappy on how they made the zipper on the bottom pouch. You have to literally hold the zipper in a perfect line or it will not shut. Additionally, the material has broken already because of the way it needs to be lined up for closing/opening. As an adult, I can figure this out and mitigate any issues but the pack is pretty small and it is being used by a brand new Boy Scout. He didn't understand as much how to line up the zipper correctly before opening and closing...so the material ripped. With that said, it still shouldn't be that difficult to open and close a zippered pouch. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Dirty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for this price range
customer_reviews.text: I just completed a 4 day Maryland AT hike with this pack and overall I was very satisfied... for the price. It was perfectly functional and carried all of my ‘stuff’ very well. That said: after 4 days I learned lighter is certainly better when hiking 40 miles... I am going to be purchasing a high end lighter pack- but then I’m paying around $300 and not under $80. This is an awesome starter pack or if you are taking shorter trips.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jason Weatherholtz

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginner or someone using it once.
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than what it claims to be, 2 different scales have it at 5lbs 1 oz. With that said though, this pack can handle a lot of weight, and seems to be very durable. Overall not a horrible pack, good for a beginner or someone who is rough on their gear. UPDATE: The fabric itself is in fact durable. The stitching.. not so much. also the adjustments do not hold on most of the straps. In my experience it isnt worth bringing on real backpacking trips.. only for quick couple miles in type of thing. Good for if you just want a pack to bring on the plane, or for sleepovers for your kids, etc.
customer_reviews.author: galluccioant

customer_reviews.title: Short torso people rejoice!
customer_reviews.text: After going through countless bags in the vain search for one that would fit my short torso properly without having the capacity of a toddler's pack for preschool, I finally found this pack. The search is over!! This pack is fantastic and is the most easily adjusted for your exact torso length of any I've tried, including a few at double the cost. I'm finally able to put all my gear in a pack & carry it easily because the weight rests where it should. Words can't express how happy I am with this bag. Hooray!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge hiker, but I did use it for one overnight camping/hiking trip and it performed great. Its harness is comfortable on the hour-plus hike and it fit everything I needed, including a sleeping bag (slung on the outside), tent, food, etc. I'm using it for my non-hiking camping trips as well. It's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: CVick

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable fully loaded on my back
customer_reviews.text: I am a 5’8, 178lbs and took this on hiking trip to Costa Rica. Offered great balance traveling through hills on foot to hike Cerro Ena among other areas. Was my main luggage bag. Took my gear for the ten days. Was able to hook my sleeping bag onto it without disturbing the comfort of it on my back. 100% endorsement of product.
customer_reviews.author: I. Rate

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out
customer_reviews.text: Just got this pack tonight. I will experiment with it over the weekend. HOWEVER.... one thing that concerns me mightely is that this pack SMELLS like toxic bug spray!. It was all over the box and all over the pack. I am concerned that this smell is toxic and poisionous. If they are spraying them with some bug spray because they are coming in from China or something they need to disclose this. It is strong!.. I don't want to get sick.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: For the price it works great. I think I will be opening the middle ...
customer_reviews.text: Backpack is functional. Would prefer a floating lid. The bottom pocket for sleeping bags is a little small and the zippers are not the easiest to move because of the angle of access. For the price it works great. I think I will be opening the middle zipper so there's one large compartment. My one biggest complaint is that the mesh pocket outside is almost useless. Most of the opening is sewn down with the straps so the entrance is very narrow. Only other real complaint is the water bottle pockets at the bottom are limited by the side pockets. So 1 liter bottles can't fit in there because they hit the side pockets in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It stays on your back!
customer_reviews.text: I downhill mountain bike at Skypark. Jumps, banked turns, all kinds of bouncing around! This bag stays on your back! It has enough storage and pockets to carry a few tools snacks, shock pump with some room to spare! With it's slim size I haven't had any snags or hangups on tree branches. I would gladly recommend this bag for out door adventure!!
customer_reviews.author: terry kitain

customer_reviews.title: Broken zipper - cheap product??
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this backpack for myself for Christmas and I’m literally FOUR days into my backpacking trip and the zipper completely broke. The bag is barely packed and the zipper is made of plastic - completely unsturdy/unreliable. I am really pissed off and want to know about warranty or a replacement considering the bag was not “misused” in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley S.

customer_reviews.title: Backpacking has never been so comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Did a shorter backpacking trip with my family (~5 miles). For my three younger siblings, ages 6 to 13, this was their first major backpacking trip, so the adults helped with carrying the heavier items. I backpacked in a tank top since it was so hot and expected my shoulders to be raw after the hike, but they weren't! After taking off the pack, I wasn't sore either. It made the trip more relaxing and enjoyable. It's a durable pack, no loose seams even with all the tugging and stretching to make everything fit and snug. Can't wait for the next adventure! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: FierceUshi

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: The bag feel good, feels a little cheap but you get what you pay for, it’s not going to fall apart but doesn’t feel indescuctable. The fit seems off, I have the bag loaded up but the waist strap doesn’t feel likes it helps take the weight. The shoulder middle link is adjusted for the right size but the waist belt sits a little above the hips. I feel like it needs more pockets, I love the separation for the sleeping bag I love the space for the water blatter
customer_reviews.author: Seth Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great features and quality, LOW price tag!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this new pack! It's already made a couple of excursions into the Alaska wilderness (we live in AK) and the performance is fantastic. Super impressed with this little pack! It fits my skinny 15 yo son perfectly... but it looks to have room for him to fill out to probably 150 lbs or so, easily. Also super impressed with TETON Sports! This is the 2nd product we've purchased from them. First was a sleeping back, and now this. Both deliver incredible features and performance for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This pack's got my back.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Backpack to handle all my supplies and literature in order to do my job during the day. This 55 liters excels in accomplishing the task and then some. The main compartment is so deep, that it could easily handle anything I would attempt to fill. With room to spare. The numerous pockets internal and external take the cake. Sturdy and comfy, the Teton Scout 3400 takes the top spot in its class and price range. Overall, exceptional product!
customer_reviews.author: Quoizimodo

customer_reviews.title: Handled the weight well and comfortably
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack for the price! I'm not an avid hiker or backpacker so I don't need a top notch backpack. Just used it this past weekend to haul the necessities 6 miles in on a 3 day hunting trip. Had the pack completely stuffed with clothes, food, hammock, rain fly, wool blanket, sleeping bag, you name it. Not being an avid hiker, all my stuff is better for camping out of my truck than it is on foot out of a backpack. Pack was easily 50+lbs and it handled it with no issues. Happy with the purchase, and it has inspired me to buy more backpack friendly gear to bring the weight down on my next trip out.
customer_reviews.author: Devin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This quality for this price?? AMAZING! no complains. I was looking for a camping bag for my son who uses it for his boyscouts camp. This product is very durable an has lot of capacity. But it's good for my son's to carry on his bag. He's 12 year old and this bag fits great on him. ( need to tight all the way tho. don't recommend for kid under 10 years old, under 85lbs) This bag comes with rain cover which is nicely attached in the bottom of the bag which I really like as my son won't lose it!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Great - Not Truly "Hydration Ready"
customer_reviews.text: So far the backpack seems to be a great quality. There is a lot of room in it, plenty of adjustment straps, and I like the bungy cord on the outside. The only downside is this is NOT truly "hydration ready" as it claims. There is a spot to hang your bladder, but there is no hole for the tube to come out at your shoulder. It has to go out the top and then back down, which can cause a kink in the line. I would have purchased a different backpack if I had realized this was the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Metz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect backpack for hiking trips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my hubby and son. They needed a backpack for a 4 day hiking/camping trip. You can really load everything you need in this pack. The price was exceptional; we looked around and most backpacks with these features were $200 or more. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S. Heflin

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this bag in 2009. TETON sent free replacement parts for them
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag in 2009 for my wife's tour in the Peace Corps. Naturally, through years of wear and tear, some of the buckles and straps had become broken. Upon contacting customer service in possibly purchasing replacement parts, they instead told us they're sending them free of charge. I'll likely be purchasing one of these bags for my niece when she graduates college, as they apparently will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Winston P. Pewin

customer_reviews.title: my daughter loves it for camping with scouts
customer_reviews.text: It's a perfect size and weight for my 10 year old daughter to use camping. Her older brother and I are both Eagle scouts and continue to go weekend camping with great frequency. She needed a backpack of her own and we eventually settled on this. The price is excellent as are the load bearing ergonomics for her stature. Honestly, this pack is as large as the one I used for a Philmont trek in the 80s. The size and color lend themselves to canoeing hunting trips in the Adirondacks. I may need to pinch it from her.
customer_reviews.author: Dean McD

customer_reviews.title: My favorite hiking bag!
customer_reviews.text: Looveee lovvveee lovveee this bag! Do yourself the favor of just buying it. Originally bought 3400 Teton bag for myself and 3700 for my boyfriend. He ended up liking mine sooo much more that we got a second 3400 now! This bag is sooo comfy to carry. You arent going to need the extra 15lbs for a bigger size because lets be honest you arent going to want to carry more and you dont need the kitchen sink.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great deal!
customer_reviews.text: My son ordered this for his trip. He is a traveler and depends on lightweight and strength with all his travel gear. This product definitely lived up to its name. Great product, great deal. It held up to it's name, never fell apart on his rough trip and is so lightweight and easy to use. I have to add, that living on Guam this item was shipped on time as stated and arrived in great condition. Great, great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Geri

customer_reviews.title: 100% quality
customer_reviews.text: This bag is really well made. The construction and the quality of the materials made me immediately feel good about the purchase before I even put it on. The drawstrings, the pockets, the integrated rain cover, the weight, the sturdiness, the space, it all just works together. You cannot go wrong with the price at all. I’d put it up against a bag twice the cost.
customer_reviews.author: chris garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great for small people
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is only 4' 10" and it is often very difficult to get hiking equipment that works for her. This is a really tough BackPack with lots of adjustments and stood up well to a 10 day hike around Bolivia including triple change flights with it going through domestic and international checked baggage systems. Great BackPack, would recommend it. It has lots of storage pockets and is well designed so you don't have to rummage or unpack to get what you need.
customer_reviews.author: ParaPilot

customer_reviews.title: Good value backpack
customer_reviews.text: This pack is well made and looks like it will be quite durable. Access to packed items is good. The torso length is easy to adjust to get the right fit. The shoulder straps and waist belt work well and are comfortable. The primary drawback is its weight, but for the price it is an excellent backpack for beginning backpackers like me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of (expletive deleted)
customer_reviews.text: I took the bag out of the box it was shipped in, removed the plastic bag, and attempted to open the pack to inspect it. I wasn't able to unzip the compartment because the zipper pulled off as soon as I put my hand on it. Don't waste your money, find a better backpack
customer_reviews.author: R.J. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Its been a year and its still in great shape.
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually rate backpacks because they will be destroyed within a month and then I have to buy another one. This bag is durable, I've used it everyday to carry my gear, bright orange is easy to see and keep my eye on from a distance, the weight is easily dispersed through the body to best allow for balance. I don't have any downsides right now but I am admittedly biased that this is a great bag. As such I ask that you take this review with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Woody

customer_reviews.title: Good starter pack
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a backpack that is just for maybe a few times use then this is it. The price is great but if you plan to hike a lot with this like more than 2-3x then get something else. The back support is poor compared to osprey or any other brand for that matter. The straps where you adjust the back starts to make noise just after 1 day hiking. The straps stretched to a point where when they rub they make an annoying noise. Other than that, it's a great bag
customer_reviews.author: 41reviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bag at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: When I decided to hike the Colorado Trail with my son in 2020, I knew I had to go as light as possible but also do it as cheaply as I could, and this backpack was the perfect solution. I had absolutely no problems with this backpack on the entire 500 mile journey; it is relatively lightweight, and it really is a fair price for what you get. The only suggestion I would make to improve the pack is to add some memory foam to the inside of the waistbelt; the current design is a little thin and cut into my hips just a little bit, especially towards the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: W. Michael DeJonge

customer_reviews.title: No idea how this pack has any good reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Just awful. I am 5'10“, medium build (for reference). This pack puts all the weight in my shoulders. I've adjusted it a thousand different ways and can't get the load off my shoulders. During a 12 mile strenuous hike, I almost ditched the whole thing. I hate it. The high shoulder adjustment is maxed out on me and won't pull any more weight away from my shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: flywatt

customer_reviews.title: Great pack
customer_reviews.text: Just took it backpacking and it worked great! Could fit so much in the pack, didn't have any trouble fitting everything I needed. Loved the extra outside pockets for organizing things I needed along the hike. Separate sleeping bag compartment was very nice to cut down on weight. Straps were very adjustable and could be made to fit me perfect. Overall, great pack for shorter torsos like women and kids. Only downside is that it is a little small for my husband who is 6'3"
customer_reviews.author: De Vinz

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: Took it backpacking at the red river gorge this weekend. Fit everything I needed, and felt great on my back. Can’t wait to test it out on longer trails and on future backpacking trips. I’m 5’2 and I adjusted it perfectly to my back. Great pack for the price. And the fact that it came with a rain cover is even better. Thanks Teton Sports for a quality pack!
customer_reviews.author: Carly S Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get back into hiking and camping but didn't want to break the bank. So glad I came across this backpack. I am a pretty large guy and most packs do not fit me , however this one fits with room to spare. It is very roomy and I am still finding little spaces here and there to stow gear. It is constructed with quality and not heavy. This pack delivers beyond the price point.
customer_reviews.author: Randall S. Macey

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great pack. I use it mostly for "Urban" trips
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great pack. I use it mostly for "Urban" trips. Have packed on the plane to Italy and the Caribbean. Also on a train trip to Colorado. Plenty of room for 1+ week trips if you don't need to carry sleeping and cooking gear. Quality is good and layout of the large compartment with smaller on the bottom is handy. I wouldn't say I know how comfortable it would be for long backpacking trips. Probably 2 hours is the longest I've worn it but it feels good when you put it on. Good adjustability of the straps.
customer_reviews.author: R.Ph.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional For Cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a backpacking trip to Colorado. I got this one for my 14 year old, rather than shelling out $270 for another Osprey (Which I love) backpack. He carried about as much weight as I did (40lbs) and said it felt pretty good, he never complained. It's definitely not as sleek or thoughtful as the more expensive ones, but I don't know how you could be it for $80.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a month long backpacking trip to the Patagonia. I'm 5'5 and this was a great size. I could spend hours talking about all the qualities that make this bag great but overall, it's a quality product, sturdy and the space is amazing. It allows for a well distribution of the weight so it doesn't strain your back as much, the hip padded buckle is priceless. The is my third teton product and I'm very satisfied with their consistency and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: 7 Years and still good....
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for 7 years and it's still as good as before! It had never failed me. I've gone on length of off the beaten path type international trips, hiking and camping with this bag and it never had a malfunction. They really should charge more for this bag and it definitely competes with more exigencies outdoor brands like Osprey.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Delecia

customer_reviews.title: Get This Bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing just as it is but for the price it's unbelievable. Get. This. Bag. The attention to quality and detail on my bag is top notch. I packed it to the brim for a week long trip to Oregon/California and it held up through air travel and hiking and continues to be one of my most favorite amazon buys. There are so many compartments and places for customizing or adding equipment. I'm so stoked I've recommended this bag to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Very nice backpack. All the zippers and straps are well made, and the material is sturdy. I love the adjustable features as well. I can use the pack (I’m 5’10”), and then adjust it down for my son, who is 5’1”. Super easy to adjust as well. It is being used for my boy Scout, who is 12, and it’s getting a lot of wear and tear. So far, it is holding up nicely. The color is true to the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Farchimp

customer_reviews.title: Survived The Maine 100 Mile Hike
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the results of this pack. Just hiked Maine's, "100 Mile Wilderness Trail" and pack held up fine. Stuffed my sleeping bag and Paria pad into the pouch (for bag only) and it held up fine. 8 days and nights of abuse in the Maine woods, didn't faze it at all. Used the convenient rain cover too. The only upgrade I'd like to see, is pouches on the front (I purchased separate ones). Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Paquin

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this backpack. The side pouches are perfect for organizing the little odds and ends such as first aid supplies, fire kits, hygiene items, etc. that he always want to keep extra handy and the outer mesh pockets on the bottom are large enough for his wide mouth nalgene bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Rick and Fanny

customer_reviews.title: Short hikes
customer_reviews.text: Went on a 2 1/2 day hike with this. Much more and you'll need a larger pack. I was pretty happy with this though. The quality is great for the price paid for sure. I never had an issue with zippers or straps, or even thinking either one would break on me. It held what I needed and carried pretty well too. All in all I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Tough, Comfy, Convenient, Super highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 for our backpack trip to Italy. Cobble stone roads, nothing but hills, wheeled luggage is definitely not the choice for Europe. These backpacks held up so nicely against our abusive usage! Shoulder straps are so comfy, and thick well padded belt definitely takes most weight off your shoulders. Very well compartmentalized inside and out, as you see, we could put water bottles, blankets, you name it. 3 weeks of necessities are well fit with expandable top. Rain cover is sooo conevenient, too. Overall, for this price, you can't ask for more. Very well thought out, constructed, strong and didn't hurt our shoulders at all. Thank you for making our trip so easy!!!! We love your product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: nao

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag. Highly Recommended for Urban Backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent backpack. I bought it for my fiancé for a recent backpacking trip across Central Europe. It fit all of her stuff for two weeks and she easily carried it everywhere. She’s a pretty light packer, but still it was great not having to roll a bag everywhere in Europe and we were able to take these on trains (and somehow it went through security, although we did have to check it on the tarmac). Only issue we had was trying to find the right fit on her back. It needs to have a tag that has quick instructions for adjusting it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack M. 19 Year Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: well made, but I would opt for the 4000 for backpacking trips
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy bag that is well made and functional for the price. I took the 3400 on a backpacking trip to Joshua Tree and found it to be adequate for a two day trip. The two top outside pouches fit Nalgene bottles well, while the bottom pouches were great for power bars, sunscreen, etc. I do think that I would have opted for a larger pack (maybe the 4000) if I had to do it again. I am 6' tall, and found the 3400 to be slightly too short for me. Also, the pack's sleeping bag pouch was slightly too small for my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: received with a tear in it
customer_reviews.text: hello, I received this item on time, and as described. it looks and feels nice and sturdy. I pulled out of the package and noticed a defect in the stitching where the water bladder tube hole is. im somewhat disappointed I have to return and buy a new one, but what can ya do. ill see if the next one has any defects
customer_reviews.author: Hotpockitrockit

customer_reviews.title: Tough and spacious backpack
customer_reviews.text: Tested this backpack on a backpacking trip in Colorado and it worked great. Filled it with supplies and it lasted me the whole week without any problems. Great storage, flexibility, durability, and look. My only complaint is comfortability. Sometimes over long periods of strain, the metal frame which keeps it sturdy, digs into your back. This is very minor and wouldn't let it be a deal breaker. If I were to do it again, Id buy this backpack. Best value for mid range backpacks.
customer_reviews.author: Geno

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR 19.5 TORSO LENGTH
customer_reviews.text: I am giving it 3 stars for the quality of the bag material. The zippers are not the easiest to operate. BUT THIS DOES NOT FIT 19.5 torso length. I emailed Teton and adjusted exactly like they said and if you measure the pack, it is 19". I carried this 23 miles last week and the pack held up very well but the hip belt like to have killed me. My pack weight was 25 pounds and I have carried much more in other packs that were more comfortable. Now I am trying to find someone to buy it off me.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack for multi day hikes
customer_reviews.text: I bought his backpack based on many favorable customer reviews on Amazon. It was delivered on time. The backpack is very well made, has many features for storing hiking stuff. I look forward to using it in the forthcoming 4 day hike in the Drakensberg, South Africa
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Yeh

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners pack
customer_reviews.text: I took this pack on a 3 day, 41 mile hike and here is what I got from it. Cons: the padding in the shoulders and hip is thick, but after 10 miles, my shoulders felt like they were being crushed. Pack weight was 30 lbs. Hip pads were blisters onto my hips and the water bottle holder stitching began to pull away from the bag. Pros: it held everything that i need it to. It's great for smaller trips and is an ideal 1st pack for someone that isn't sure if they'll get into backpacking. For a beginning backpacker, go for it. If you're seasoned to backpacking, you might want to look at some other packs.
customer_reviews.author: Steven DeLawder

customer_reviews.title: Good for a day or multiple days hiking.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second teton backpack ,got this one for my wife she loves it .fits her very well with the main pouch and all the pockets it has enough room for everything you need for a day hike or several days out on the trail.The most important thing to do is put your gear in your pack and put it on and adjust the pack to your body,it's alot easier in your living room that out on the trail.for the money I don't think you can beat teton packs.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: For people up to 5' 9"
customer_reviews.text: Great pack, great features but, until I got the pack, I did not know that this was for people up to 5' 9". (I'm 6' even) I did not find this information anywhere on the page before buying it. The tag on the pack, regarding torso-length adjustments, reads: "Reposition shoulder straps to provide a comfortable fit for all body shapes and sizes up to 5' 9" " (See attached pic, section J) Just note this before buying it. I wish it were my size...it's well laid out, good compartments, lots of straps for things. If it fits YOU, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: mAvSo

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Mine came without the rain cover really?, the mesh on the back does not stretch and feels like nothing will fit in it. No strap for an axe. Zippers are hard enough to open I feel I will break then trying to open.
customer_reviews.author: Ezekiel

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first backpacking bag I've ever owned, so I don't have much to go by, but I've taken this on about five trip into the wilderness now, and I'm very pleased with the purchase. For what I spent, I'm impressed with the quality and craftsmanship. After using it a couple of times, I kept being surprised about zippers and intuitive features that I wasn't aware of at the time of purchase and wasn't expecting. I can see myself using this bag for years to come. Thank you, Teton! :)
customer_reviews.author: aggie4life

customer_reviews.title: not as described
customer_reviews.text: The backpack looks great, however it doesn't come as described. One thing was that when I purchased it, and even the tag on the backpack says it has hip pockets, but there are no hip pockets. There are also no compression straps on the sides as noted on in the description " Side and front compression straps to secure sleeping bag, pad or tent" These were a few of the features I was looking for in a backpack. Considering a return. I am hoping they have another version they can send me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for boy scouts
customer_reviews.text: I purchsed this for my son who recently bridged to boy scouts. This is the perfect size for him-he's 5' tall. He definitely will be able to use this for a several years. It has lots of pockets to keep his ten essentials and snacks at hand. You can also add a hydration bladder. I am also thinking about getting one for myself. There are other boys in his troop who have the same pack. I couldn't find a place for a name tag like they do on luggage.
customer_reviews.author: flo

customer_reviews.title: VERY WELL MADE PACK LOTSSSSS FOR THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Very well made pack. I had some trouble with the first one as the hip belt came with a "kink" in the padding. Sent it back and Amazon was great. I am looking forward to using this pack. I read many good reviews about it. Teton products are a welcome addition to the outdoor market as they give good products, well thought out, and heavily constructed at a REASONABLE price. You don't have to break the bank to gear up. Only reason it received four stars is because of the kink in the hip belt......
customer_reviews.author: Papa Jake

customer_reviews.title: Took this backpack to Mt. Kilimanjaro.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a light weight backpack, more than a day pack, on the hike up the mountain. It worked great. No tears, was abused. I am an experienced hiker, did 860 miles of the AT last year and I would not recommend one like this for that trip, but for a week or two excursions, it would be great. It took a lot of abuse and, other than really dirty, no problems. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding pack for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pack for about a month now and have been on two trips with it. It holds up well to the elements (and inquisitive racoons). I bought the orange pack for the high visibility and it is great, not obnoxiously colored, but very noticeable. I highly suggest buying a water bladder for it. It suggests and I have a 2.5L bladder, but it might be able to hold a 3L. My only complaint is that the velcro for the adjustable back length came loose on the trail, not sure if it was my fault or the velcro is wearing out already. GREAT value for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: CKirk

customer_reviews.title: Great pack but a few flaws.
customer_reviews.text: I love this pack! Not as many options as a higher end Osprey or similar but for the price it cannot be beat. What I like: size, top inner/outer pockets, side pockets, bottom pocket and straps. What I dislike: it’s a little on the heavy side and the zippers SUCK! I have taken this on backpack camping trips a few times now and overall I believe it’s a good option for the money.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Great Pack!
customer_reviews.text: This pack is fantastic! My son is transitioning from Cub Scouts to Boy Scouts and I bought this for him for his first BS camp out. It is a great pack! I love the fact that the torso length is adjustable so he can grow into it. Perfect for a young Boy Scout!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Doriocourt

customer_reviews.title: Great for a 10 yr old
customer_reviews.text: This was my sons first scout hike and camp and the backpack fit all his essentials. We were able to attach his roll, and full size sleeping bag to the outside with no problems. We also loved that his camel pack could be hung inside this bag and them removed to place in the day pack for hiking. Perfect size for young boys.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight pack.. just not enough space
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight pack. Just felt a little off to me. Very possible that I just could not adjust it correctly but seemed too short in the torso. I am 5’8” woman. Torso is 19. Also did not have as much space as I needed. The sleeping bag compartment would be better used for an extra pair of boots. No way to attach an extreme weather sleeping bag, made by the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: ... as a starter pack to see how much I liked hiking, well
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a starter pack to see how much I liked hiking, well, I love it, and this pack has held up well over the last year. I'd like to eventually get something lighter, but its a good pack and there are plenty of other ultra lightweight swaps in my kit with higher priority.
customer_reviews.author: T. Zernicke

customer_reviews.title: Waist belt is too small for average teens or adults
customer_reviews.text: As others have said these are a good value, but the waist belt on this one seems to be sized for middle school kids. The padded section is 27" long and doesn't cover the points of your hips in front if you are an average teen or adult. Due to the thickness of the padding, which is fine, the belt barely covered a 22" distance from hip point to hip point measured around the back, wearing only a T shirt. Heavier, cold weather clothing would make this fit situation worse. Back to the drawing board!
customer_reviews.author: SuperTeacher

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable pack for hiking and travelling.
customer_reviews.text: My 16 y.o. son needed a new pack for out 600km hike along the Camino de Santiago, and this one fit the bill exactly. My son is 6'4" and the adjustable strap height was great - my 5'6" wife could wear it comfortably as well. That's like 195 and 154cm for all you wonderful people from countries that haven't landed on the moon.
customer_reviews.author: D. Combellick

customer_reviews.title: Stitch quality is concerning for a critical piece of outdoor gear.
customer_reviews.text: The velcro stitching used to close off the pocket for the bag's rain cover was coming off right out of the box. This worries me as I had to reinforce this stitching. Do I have to reinforce everything else before I take it on a multi-day trek? Sure, I can bring along a sewing kit, but my peace of mind is pulled by an integral item that I feel shouldn't be a problem this early on. Not a good start with the products from this company. Otherwise, the form, fit, and utility with its many pockets are quite nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rick ;)

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 10yr old son. He is in scouts and will soon be crossing from cubs to Boy scouts. I wanted a pack that was not too big and heavy for him, but would still be useful for him for years to come. This fit the bill nicely. It is a little big for him right now, the way he is growing it won't be long. It is adjustable to grow with him for a few years to come. The pockets and straps are nice, it won't match up to my kelty red cloud but didn't cost near as much. The built in rain fly is an added bonus. Lot's of room inside.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Maddux

customer_reviews.title: Good youth pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these for the young guys in our Scout troop, and they have been just right for lending them. Not too big, but can hold what a Scout should bring on a 1-2-night campout. A good buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Haul your gear comfortably, with this Teton pack
customer_reviews.text: Grabbed this pack for an overnight hike (16miles), and am very pleased with the purchase. The pack rode well on my back, and felt well balanced (which is awesome considering I am terrible at packing). I'm 6'2'' 220lbs , and the fit was just right. I didn't fiddle too much with adjustments, so it could probably have been an even smoother hike had I taken the time to fine tune the fittings. The bag has plenty of lash points and loops for external gear. I'm extremely happy with the price as well. Only negative I can pinpoint, is the string caps aren't particularly robust, but if you can tie a knot that is a non-issue.
customer_reviews.author: DrNecropolis

customer_reviews.title: It will fit in the carry on... With some elbow grease.
customer_reviews.text: It will fit into the carryon sizing box.... BARELY... but it will fit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great pack for the price. The one I bought was in "Very Good" condition, but it appeared new when I got it. Pretty good storage space. Took it on a 15 mile hike at 10,000 feet elevation and it was comfortable enough. I also like the pull over rain cover in the bottom of the pack. Great pack for the $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adjustments just wouldn’t stay. Uncomfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Pack fit a good load of stuff inside - however no adjustment would stick for more than 15 minutes. With the pack fully adjusted, it would stay “semi-comfortable” for a little bit, and then go to pulling a person backwards, or slip down on the shoulders, causing bad hunching, shrugging, etc. to compensate. When doing a 23 mile, 4 day trip, you can’t stop every few minutes to adjust and expect to get anywhere. I’ll be returning this and looking for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Jublin

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Teton and Amazon-Sports! A++
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bag so much that I bought another one after my first one was ripped up by a bear (ice storm came through and broke the branch my stuff was hanging on during the night... rough hike that weekend) The adjustable strap height and padding have let me truck hundreds of miles with little to no discomfort (from the bag), rainfly works great and exterior pouches for quick needs, emergency, and food are clutch. I have used this for over 2 years of hiking, travelling, military, etc... It has done and seen some stuff that I wouldn't recommend but still looks brand new and everything functions. Thanks Teton, Amazon-Sports!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Missing waist belt strap keepers
customer_reviews.text: I have received my Teton 3400 that I intend to use in my "Camino de Santiago" hiking. It seems a fine backpack and just like the product advertised except that mine came without the waist belt strap keepers. This is just a detail, but in a 500 miles walk I'd rather count with all the benefits I can get from the product. Hope the manufacturer can send me the waist belt strap keepers, so that I don't have to return the backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jose P Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last minute to replace a backpack I had recently lost. For what it is, and for the price, it is a great bag. I did 5 days on the Middle Fork Kaweah River with it. Ultimately, the bag is what you paid for, and the second to last day the chest strap tore off, and required a paracord replacement on trail. 3/5 Stars for a cheap bag that mostly held together and isn't too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Ainslie

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: I used this once and the stitching for the camel back holder is coming undone already. Of course I can't figure out how to return or speak with someone since it is past the 30 day amazon policy. I should have bought something at REI or even walmart at least there I'd be able to get the warranty to take care of the issue.
customer_reviews.author: SGP4

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: Great pack! I just used this in a 5-day primitive survival course in the mountains and it performed flawlessly. It held up in the pouring rain and only a minimal amount of my gear was wet. The pack is comfortable to carry and the adjustment straps allow you to fit it to your own preferences. I would definitely buy this pack again, although I don't believe I will have to for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Good mid-size backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these for my kids, who are in scouts. They use them for weekend camping trips and find them to be very good. They are comfortable to hike with, and can handle a decent amount of equipment, with plenty of straps and pockets for additional items.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wood

customer_reviews.title: A great backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old favorite that had just reached the end of its useful life. I had looked at Dick’s Field & Stream, REI and other locations but either the price was ridiculous or the quality was terrible. I took a gamble on this for my trip to Peru. I’d purchase this pack again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Small water bottle pockets, sturdy frame, great at  holding weight
customer_reviews.text: Took this pack to the boundary waters for a 3 today trip. Packed it with 60 pounds of gear.. and it held up fantastic! Made every Portage easy. The water bottle pockets are only good for long narrow bottles, but Camelbak makes the perfect 750ml bottles for the pockets. The sleep bag compartment is also very small, but it does have a zipper between that and the main one so I could open it up and make room. I'm buying the same pack again in orange for my wife! Will update the review the more we use them.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Good pack. Lots of room. Not too heavy.
customer_reviews.text: awesome pack. I use this to hold my tent, food, water, and med kit for camping. I use a smaller pack for everything else. This holds a LOT of stuff and it well designed. The adjustable panel makes it a good fit for different size people. Overall a great product and I intend on putting it to the limits this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.  Don't spend big.
customer_reviews.text: I really have no complaints about this pack. I've been hiking for many years and mostly had external frame packs so I wanted to get with the fad and try this one and not spend much money. Totally worth it. My dad spends big time money on hiking equipment. He's spent well over $1,000 at REI trying to nail down a good internal frame pack. He won't head my advice to try this one and I assume it's because of the cost. Cheap so it must be cheap quality. Nope. I've logged 220 miles with it over 3 years and have not had one single problem. I'm 5'7 160 lbs and have it adjusted to fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Have so much of my survival gear in there already. my rifle butt fits perfectly in the bungee side pocket and I just took a presik tied around one of the pole loopes and the barrel nice and snug. I can't stress enough if you good at efficiency packing this is the bag, so many great compression loops, gear loops, etc.. and to top it all off I still have room in the main compartment! The only complaint I have is that I wish the compartment from sleeping bag to main compartment had a zipper on top side. I hope this helps all you ambitious adventurers like me!
customer_reviews.author: Trippiehippieblunton

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been backpacking since I was a young teenager. The last few years my husband has gone on our trips with me and I got him this pack. He's 5'9" 200lbs and this pack fits him perfectly. It has great pockets and great padding on the waste belt. Perfect amount of room for a multi day park! I would highly recommend this as a inexpensive first backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany & Adam Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Very good pack
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this backpack for my adult daughter for a trip we are planning. I have been wearing it as a test and I think I like it better than the one I already have. It has a lot of pockets and is well designed. Terrific value and quality.
customer_reviews.author: misterdaveusa

customer_reviews.title: Nice midsize bag.  Fit 5'4" wife very well.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife. She liked this a lot and carried about 30lbs of gear with no issues. I almost took one star way for the zippers, they aren't bad, but are a bit hard to operate on the sleeping bag compartment. The padding is generous on the waist and shoulder harness. This is a nice bag for the money. In fact I would say its a great bag for the money. Would like to see some straps on the sides for trekking poles, and the sleeping bag compartment is a bit small for anything other than a summer bag. Materials are robust and I found no problems with seams, stitching or construction.
customer_reviews.author: Fwayne

customer_reviews.title: Great first 'real' backpack. Good ol' reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 6 day backpacking trip on the Appalachian trail. Seems just the right size to fit everything I need - which includes a small stove, 6 day worth of food (compacted into plastic baggies), tent, sleeping pad, changes of clothes, first aid kit, and two water bottles. Also other miscellaneous accessories. I've never had a 'real' backpack before - this is definitely impressive. I'm sure real backpackers might have nicer packs, but unless you're going out for weeks at a time, I see no reason why this wouldn't fit the bill. I'm 5'6, female, and 150lbs with an athletic build. Fit me perfectly right out of the box, no fuss.
customer_reviews.author: sydney

customer_reviews.title: I bought this item for my 15 year old son ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my 15 year old son to take with him backpacking across Catalina Island in mid March. So far it fits him well and can be adjusted. He is 5’5 and about 140 pounds. There is a lot of room inside for our 3 night trip. I will update my review after my trip and let everyone know how it held up.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

product_meta.title: TETON Sports Scout 3400 Internal Frame Backpack; High-Performance Backpack for Backpacking, Hiking, Camping
product_meta.description: Incredible views and remote trails are just some of the rewards you’ll enjoy when you’re backpacking in the wilderness. And because backpacking can push you to your limits, you need a backpack that can keep up with you and your latest adventure. The Scout 3400 is a high-quality backpack that is loaded with features like a sleeping bag compartment, compression straps, and multiple compartments and pockets for strategic packing. Comfort features include a padded back panel that is channeled for optimal airflow, padded lumbar and waist and shoulder straps that help carry the load. Adjust the torso, waist, chest and shoulders to fit men, women and youth. The Scout 3400 Internal Frame Backpack was designed with you in mind. But don’t take our word for it—read the reviews! The Scout 3400 is helping thousands of backpackers enjoy The Great Outdoors.
feature_bullets: VERSATILE QUICK TRIP PACK: Just right for youth and adults for light backpacking trips; best for 2-4-day adventures; 3400 cubic inches (55 L) capacity; weighs 4.5 pounds (2 kg)
COMFORT YOU CAN CUSTOMIZE: Multi-position torso adjustment fits wide range of body sizes; Durable open-cell foam lumbar pad and molded channels provide maximum comfort and airflow

TRUSTED QUALITY: Hiking backpack with hundreds of verified 5-star reviews testifying to the quality and design; sleeping bag compartment, compression straps, and exterior pockets for strategic packing
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports

NOT YOUR BASIC BACKPACK: Continues to be the top selling internal frame backpack on Amazon at a great price for all the included features; Backpack for men and women. Waist Belt- Adjustable 26 - 60 inches. Torso Length- Adjustable 15 - 19.5 inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
